page.title: 08BESSES O' TH' BARN BAND.
page.content: This famous band started out as "Clegg's Reed Band", formed by the Clegg brothers, who were local cotton manufacturers, in 1818. The present conductor of the band is Roy Newsome. He has led them to many contest wins, such as North West Area Champions in 1979 and 1981, and British Open Champions in 1982. Apart from contests the band also does many concerts all over the country and has even travelled to Holland, Germany, and Switzerland to perform. They have performed many times on both Radio and T.V. and made several records. The band's practice room for many years has been in a very cramped building at the top of Moss Lane, Whitefield. The original band, however, practiced in the Besses o' th' Barn Inn.
